DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluated the clinical response of the efficacy and safety of the combination therapy of peginterferon alfa-2a and ribavirin, compared with an antiviral treatment-free group in CHC patients with compensated LC. Additionally, this study evaluated the dosage reactivity and the pharmacokinetic characteristics of the combination therapy of peginterferon alfa-2a and ribavirin in CHC patients with compensated LC.
DOC.brief_title: A Study of Peginterferon Alfa-2a in Combination With Ribavirin in Chronic Hepatitis C (CHC) Patients With Compensated Liver Cirrhosis (LC)
DOC.criteria: Patients aged 20 to 75 yearsold with quantifiable serum HCVRNA (≥ 500 IU/mL), elevated serum alanine aminotransferase activity (≥ 45 IU per liter) within sixty days of screening, and proven CHC with compensated LC (ChildPugh A) on liver biopsy. Patients with neutropenia (fewer than 1,500 neutrophils per cubic millimeter) Thrombocytopenia (fewer than 75,000 platelets per cubic millimeter) Anemia (less than 12 g hemoglobin per deciliter ) Hepatitis B coinfection; decompensated liver disease. Organ transplant Creatinine clearance less than 50 milliliters per minute Poorly controlled psychiatric disease Poorly controlled diabetes Malignant neoplastic disease Severe cardiac or chronic pulmonary disease Immunologically mediated disease Retinopathy
